ProgramElementNote.val: Adjustments to Budget Years:  Army added funds in FY 15 to begin development of the Lightweight CLU to address user feedback on weight and bulk and to address the Close Combat Missiles System - Medium Capability Production Document objective system weight requirement.

ProgramElementMissionDescription.val: FY15 funding will fund developmental engineering of the Javelin Lightweight Command Launch Unit (CLU).  Goal of the Javelin Lightweight CLU is a 50% reduction in size and weight, while meeting detect, recognize, and identify requirements.  Javelin Lightweight CLU is a result of user feedback on weight and bulk, and addresses the Close Combat Missiles System - Medium Capability Production Document objective system weight requirement.

ProjectMissionDescription.val: FY15 funding will fund developmental engineering of the Javelin Lightweight Command Launch Unit (CLU).  Goal of the Javelin Lightweight CLU is a 50% reduction in size and weight, while meeting detect, recognize, and identify requirements.  Javelin Lightweight CLU is a result of user feedback on weight and bulk, and addresses the Close Combat Missiles System - Medium Capability Production Document objective system weight requirement.

Description.val: Improve the current Javelin missile with multi-purpose warhead (MPWH) (FY13-14).  Develop Lightweight Command Launch Unit (FY15-19).

Text.val: Javelin MPWH component qualification testing, final design review, and system level integration (non-flight) testing to prepare for system qualification.
Javelin MPWH system qualification (flight), live fire testing for integration into Javelin Block I missile.  CLU Far Target Locator demonstrations and user evaluations.

Lightweight CLU system architecture design, research and design advanced lightweight composite materials for CLU housing, research and design small form factored / lightweight acquisition sensor and associated optics, and initiation of prototype software / firmware design.

OtherProgramFundingSummaryRemarks.val: FY 15-19 procurement funds are to procure missiles only.  No CLUs will be procured with these funds.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: Javelin Lightweight CLU development will be conducted by the Javelin Joint Venture (Raytheon, Tucson, AZ, and Lockheed Martin, Orlando, FL).  Engineering services contract with the Javelin Joint Venture will be utilized for Lightweight CLU development efforts. The major subassemblies, which are also the primary cost drivers, will be competed.  The Javelin Joint Venture has invested Industry Research and Development in the Lightweight CLU.  Development, prototype, and testing will occur FY15-19 with production beginning FY20.  Current plan is to field to priority Infantry Brigade Combat Teams and Special Forces and cascade Block 0 CLUs out of the inventory.

PerformingActivity.val: Close Combat Weapon Systems Project Office
